body:
As this appears to be a bug from modifying example's code, may be worth asking on [SO](stackoverflow.com/). This and other errors might be fixed in dev branch, or latest stable branch - installed respectively via

```
pip install git+https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio.git@dev
pip install git+https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio.git@refs/pull/674/head
```

> As this appears to be a bug from modifying example's code, may be worth asking on [SO](stackoverflow.com/). This and other errors might be fixed in dev branch, or latest stable branch - installed respectively via
> 
> ```
> pip install git+https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio.git@dev
> pip install git+https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio.git@refs/pull/674/head
> ```

I am already running the dev branch in both cases. I am running Tensorflow version 2.8.0. Here is the output of the versions of modules specified by filing bugs:

```python
import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.__version__)
2.8.0

import platform; print(platform.platform())
Windows-10-10.0.19041-SP0

import sys; print("Python", sys.version)
Python 3.8.2 (tags/v3.8.2:7b3ab59, Feb 25 2020, 23:03:10) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]

import numpy; print("NumPy", numpy.__version__)
NumPy 1.21.0

import scipy; print("SciPy", scipy.__version__)
SciPy 1.8.0

import torch; print("PyTorch", torch.__version__)
PyTorch 1.11.0+cpu

import kymatio; print("Kymatio", kymatio.__version__)
Kymatio 0.3.dev0
```

Even running the that example's code exactly (downloading the provided python file) gives me the error:

```python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "classif_keras.py", line 143, in <module>
    x = Scattering1D(J, Q=Q)(x_in)
  File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\keras\utils\traceback_utils.py", line 67, in error_handler
    raise e.with_traceback(filtered_tb) from None
  File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\tensorflow\python\autograph\impl\api.py", line 692, in wrapper
    raise e.ag_error_metadata.to_exception(e)
AttributeError: Exception encountered when calling layer "scattering1d" (type Scattering1D).        

in user code:

    File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\kymatio\frontend\keras_frontend.py", line 17, in call  *
        return self.scattering(x)
    File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\kymatio\frontend\keras_frontend.py", line 14, in scattering  *
        return self.S.scattering(x)
    File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\kymatio\scattering1d\frontend\tensorflow_frontend.py", line 53, in scattering  *
        S = scattering1d(x, self.pad_fn, self.backend.unpad, self.backend, self.J, self.log2_T, self.psi1_f, self.psi2_f,
    File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\kymatio\scattering1d\core\scattering1d.py", line 76, in scattering1d  *
        U_0 = pad_fn(x)
    File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\kymatio\scattering1d\frontend\base_frontend.py", line 80, in pad_fn  *
        self.pad_mode)
    File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\kymatio\scattering1d\backend\tensorflow_backend.py", line 71, in pad  *
        return agnostic.pad(x, pad_left, pad_right, pad_mode, axis=axis)
    File "C:\Users\xwb18152\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python38\site-packages\kymatio\scattering1d\backend\agnostic_backend.py", line 36, in pad  *
        axis_idx = axis if axis >= 0 else (x.ndim + axis)

    AttributeError: 'Tensor' object has no attribute 'ndim'


Call arguments received:
  â€¢ x=tf.Tensor(shape=(None, 8192), dtype=float32)
```
Possibly `.ndim` was deprecated in the new TF version. For now I suggest replacing it with its equivalent, like `len(x.shape)`.
I attempted at making a pull request, however before this - diving into the code I can't trace to the agnostic_backend as there's no files with this in the repo. Where is this coming from? heh.

The commit this refers to enables this to work with the specs I have (i.e. tf 2.8.0, etc.), however running times are very noticeably slow (much slower than those referred to in the documented examples. Unsure as to why this is the case, but diminishes practical usability of kymatio / wavelet scattering.

Furthermore, for larger sample lengths (i.e. `T = 2**20` as opposed to the example's `T = 2**13`), training epochs take an inordinate amount of time to compute and sometimes hang. Of course this is computationally expensive, however even the 1D scattering example (keras) takes a fair while to finish (much longer than is suggested by documentation).
@ryankshah Can you please provide me with the npz files? trying to replicate this issue.
@ryankshah alternatively, input and output shape would be nice to know.

@MuawizChaudhary you can infer the input shape from the variable `T`. The NPZ files are unfortunately private research however they are simply radio-frequency signals sampled at 2MHz with each sample 2s long. You could always just fabricate a synthetic input signal to mimic this. As for the output shape, there are 10 neurons in the softmax layer. However, the program never reached this point as it would fail at line 145 (`x = Scattering1D(J, Q=Q)(x_in)`)

[on my end](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/16qJ0f5-G6_FPKgo99Hf39GrH0QznC3pn?usp=sharing), it seems to pass line 145 (I tested with your J, T, Q, and also with smaller.). Furthermore, like you, I see nothing about an agnostic backend. Perhaps this was added and then removed. Perhaps you were using #738 ? 

It does error out with the following when you try summarizing our scattering object... 
```
ValueError: Error processing property 'phi_f' of DictWrapper({0: array(....
``` 
And it does appear to make alot of function calls when its running... 
[image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39755015/171431232-93d7121d-225c-4ddd-8178-bda940d642e8.png)


Whose our local Keras expert here?

issue.title: Keras Scattering1D example does not work with TF>=2.5

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.title: Examples are not in CI

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body: Following offline discussion with @lostanlen. Since examples are not tested regularly, they *will* break (see #817, #801, #775) without us realizing it. We should aim to have the examples run at somewhat regularly so we can stay ahead of these things. This will probably include trimming down the examples to a smaller and easier maintainable set.

body: @ryankshah #882 should have fixed this issue. Please reopen if the new dev branch does not fix your issue.

issue.title: TST add summary call to keras 1d and 2d tests.

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body: This PR tests if we actually fix an error claimed to be fixed  by #883  #882 which resolve issues #775 #801.
